chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Zachery S. Weber was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

Notice to Def-installation of ignition interlock device, cost reduction on IID, and links to Information on DMV website.
Mandatory interlock for all alcohol concentration-License restricted to interlocked vehicles, plus all registered and titled vehicles (unless exempted) for a period of no less than one year BEGINNING when the license is issued.

miscConds.notes: cost/fines/fees added to payment plan $35 per month for the next two months then resume $75 biweekly

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Def is to obtain a psych evaluation and complete recommended treatment.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Def to enroll in the Ashland County Adult Drug Court & complete successfully. Completion of the Ashland County Drug Court is an integral part of the judgment and failure to successfully complete will result in the case being brought back to court for further sentencing
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Granted credit for time served 
Granted good time
Defendant has 10 days to contact the Ashland County Jail to set up the time to begin serving his sentence.
180 DAYS OF THE 360 DAYS ARE IMPOSED AND STAYED PENDING COMPLETION OF DRUG COURT.

Defendant Zachery S. Weber in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA agreemnt plea to Ct 1 16CF56, others charges and 16CF88 DRI. Rec WH sent 30mo prob, 360 jail 180 IS pending compl drug court. 180 stayed to be used as sanctions if neccessary. AODA, no MAS, not present, UA, comply/complete Drg ct, Psy eval, other counsel, DNA, fine, 30 mo Rev, 30 mo IID. Fail to comply with Drg Ct, return for resentencing. Def plea NC. Admits 4th offense. 16CF56 Ct2 and 3 DRI and 16CF88 DRI. Def found Guilty
Judgment Sent WH prob 30mo, report DOC 24hrs, comply with all rule/cond/term and comply Drg Ct-intergral component of judgment.  360 days jail-180 days I.S. pending completion of Drg Ct, 180 days avail as sanction. Failure to successfully complete Drg Ct would be brought back for sentencing. 180 days time served, 2days TS, good time/work release, 10days to contact ACJ, begin serving by 6/26 9am, AODA, abs sob, Rx only as prescribed, not present MAS, UA, psy eval, counsel, DNA, $600 plus costs= $1778.70 pay through COC, bail applied. $35 per month for 2 months then resume. 30 mo rev, 30 mo IID, granted cost reduction, no gun no vote
Rev effective date of admin susp
  Further proceedings scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Days to pay scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:00 am.
